PHC  
  
  
GEOGRAPHY AND   
METEOROLOGY  
ESUTECH  
   b. NCE credit in Geography and one (1) teaching subject in the 
Social Sciences, Arts or Science.  
c. ND upper credit level in Urban/Regional Planning or 
Environmental Science.  
(xiv) LAGOS acceptsvery good passes in three (3) JUPEB/ ‘A’ level 
subjects:   Geography and any two (2) of Economics, 
Chemistry, Biology, Physics, and Government.  
(xv) ABUJA accepts two (2) 'A' level passes in Geography and 
any other Science subject, Economics or Go vernment. 
ND upper credit in Surveying, Town planning or 
Environmental management.  
(xvi) FED-DUTSINMA accepts two (2) 'A' level passes in 
Geography and one (1) of Economics, Government, History, 
Physics, Chemistry and Biology. Accepts ND/NCE with good 
grades in any relevant programme/subject.  
(xvii) OAU accepts  
a. 'A' Level in Geography and any two (2) Science or   
Humanities subjects  
b. ND/HND upper credit in Surveying and Geo -
informatics, Land Surveying, Urban and Regional 
Planning, Statistics, Mathematics or Tourism  
  
   UTME  
(i) OAU requires ‘O’ level credit passes in Mathematics, 
Geography and any two (2) from Economics, Government, 
Chemistry, Physics, Biology/Agricultural Science, Christian 
Religious Studies /Islamic Studies, Yoruba, Civic Education, 
ICT/Animal Husbandry, History, Literature in English.  
(ii) IBADAN accepts  
a. Candidates who did not offer Geography at UTME, but has 'O' 
level credit pass in the subject.  
b. Five (5)/six (6) 'O' level credit passes at one or two (2) sittings to 
include English Language, Geography and any three (3) Arts or 
Social Science subjects with at least pass in Mathematics.  
(iii) BSU requires 'O' level credit pass in Mathematics.  
(iv) LASU accepts ‘O’ level credit passes in English Language, 
Geography, and any three (3) of Economics, Government, 
Physics, Chemistry, Biology and Additional Mathematics. 'O' 
level pass in Mathematics is also accepted.
